Description: Papyrus (upper part); Demotic legal text recto; names of thirteen witnesses verso.
Curator's comments: No acquisition details are recorded, apart from a comment in the registers 'incorporated into the collection after reassembly and repair'. According to Shore's remarks EA 10792 was 'identified among unaccessioned material .. in 1960', then conserved by Stanley Baker and then registered (see bibliography for EA 10792), and the same is presumably true of the group EA 10787-92. Lower part of the same document is P. Michigan Inv. 4526. See also Nim in JEA 24 (1938), 79. Based on content, from Philadelphia.
Bibliographic references: Shore 1980 / Declaration of Tikas, 184 B.C. (P. BM 10789)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (46009) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/46009)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: bloom, fractured, loss Black ink (abraded, loss) Tabbed: silk Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: cloth Object Priority: B Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: B Curatorial condition comment: fair
